title: Knowledge Check

questions.text: What is Gazebo primarily used for in robotics development?
options: To simulate robots and their environments
To create user interfaces for robots
questions.explanation: Gazebo is a 3D simulation environment that allows developers to test robots and their algorithms in realistic virtual environments before deploying to real hardware.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a typical sensor simulated in Gazebo?
questions.explanation: While Gazebo can simulate many types of sensors including LIDAR, cameras, and IMUs, microphone simulation is not typically implemented in Gazebo as audio simulation is complex and less commonly needed for robotics applications.

questions.text: What advantage does simulation provide in robotics development?
options: It completely replaces the need for real robots
It allows for safe testing and rapid iteration without hardware risks
It guarantees that algorithms will work on real robots
It reduces the need for any physical testing
questions.explanation: Simulation allows developers to test algorithms safely, iterate quickly, and avoid potential damage to expensive hardware during development. However, real-world testing is still necessary for final validation.
